did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

did.abstract: The Bernard M. Bench collection contains a resume and professional correspondence with oil companies. It also contains a railroad survey and articles by Bench about Rangely field. Geological maps, articles, and reports about coal exploration make up the rest of the collection.

bioghist.head: Biography of Bernard M. Bench
bioghist.p: Bernard M. Bench graduated from the Colorado School of Mines as a Geological Engineer in 1930. He worked for various private seismic corporations in Texas until he returned to the School of Mines as a graduate student. He entered the Army Engineers in 1941 and served in the China-Burma-India Theatre until 1945. He then worked as a consultant in Denver, Colorado. From 1961 to 1971, he helped with coal exploration and development in Korea, Mexico, Egypt, India, and Indonesia. He returned to Denver in 1972 and specialized in testing coalbeds in New Mexico, Colorado and Pennsylvania. He retired in 1981.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a resume and professional correspondence with oil companies. It also contains a railroad survey and articles by Bench about Rangely field. Geological maps, articles, and reports about coal exploration make up the rest of the collection.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no other known archival collections created by Bernard M. Bench at the date of processing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Bernard M. Bench papers, 1941-1989, were given to the American Heritage Center by Bernard M. Bench in 1989. The papers were received in good condition and partial order.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by John Hanks in February 2001. The materials have been arranged by type, chronologically within series. Descriptive titles have been created.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Item Description, Box Number, Folder Number, Bernard M. Bench papers, 1941-1989, Collection Number 00151, American Heritage Center, University of Wyoming.
